content: How can I help you today?

Well, my wife pushed me to come here because things at home have been really tough. Our son has been struggling a lot, and it’s been affecting our whole family. I’m not really sure if this will help, but I just feel stuck right now.

It sounds like things have been really challenging for you and your family, especially with your son going through a difficult time. Feeling stuck can be overwhelming, especially when it’s impacting your loved ones too. It’s good that you’re here, even if you’re unsure about it—it shows that you care deeply about your family and want to find a way forward. Would you like to talk more about what’s been going on or how it’s been affecting you?

I guess a big part of it is that my son’s behavior has been so out of control, and my wife and I can’t seem to agree on how to handle it. It’s putting so much strain on us, and I feel like everything is falling apart. I don’t even know where to start, honestly.

It sounds like you’re carrying a lot right now—managing your son’s challenges while also feeling this disconnect with your wife on how to approach things. That strain must feel heavy, especially when it feels like everything is falling apart. Starting can feel hard when the challenges seem overwhelming, but just sharing this shows how much you care about your family and want things to improve. What do you feel has been the hardest part for you in all of this?

I think the hardest part is feeling like no matter what I try, it’s never enough. I just want to help my son, but I don’t know how. And on top of that, it’s like my wife and I are constantly at odds about everything—we barely talk without arguing. It’s exhausting.

That sounds emotionally draining—wanting so badly to help your son but feeling like your efforts aren’t enough, while also trying to navigate the tension with your wife. It seems like you’re caught between trying to support your son and trying to keep your relationship with your wife steady, which must feel really overwhelming. It’s clear how much you care about your family. What do you think might help ease some of this exhaustion for you?

To be honest, I don’t even know what would help. Maybe just figuring out what’s going on with my son would make things feel less chaotic, but I’m not sure where to start with that either. And with my wife… I don’t know if we’ll ever agree on anything related to him. It’s just so hard to see a way out of this.

It sounds like finding clarity about your son’s struggles feels really important to you—it could help you feel more grounded and maybe ease some of the chaos you’re experiencing. At the same time, the tension with your wife feels like an added layer that’s making things even harder for you. Not knowing where to start can feel overwhelming, but it’s also understandable given everything you’re juggling. What would it mean to you to get a better sense of what’s going on with your son or to find even a small step toward understanding?

It would mean a lot, honestly. If I could just figure out what’s going on with him, maybe we’d have a chance at helping him and working through all of this as a family. I just feel like we’re grasping at straws, and it’s wearing me down. I’m scared that if we don’t figure this out soon, it’s going to tear us all apart.

It sounds like your family’s well-being means so much to you, and you really want to find a way to help your son and bring everyone together. The uncertainty and fear of things falling further apart seem heavy on your shoulders, and it’s clear you’re deeply invested in finding a path forward.
